See Response in Discussion. Comments on "debate" dropped, but this is an accurate description of current state of affairs.
/* Extrapolations of the meaning of feudalism */
Show me your sources for this "debate" between medievalists and non-Medievalists. See discssuon for more..
You people are ruling this page like absolutist monarchs, insisting everyone else is wrong. Stop acting like immature tyrants and let the rest of us contribute to this page. There is room for both!
The claim all scholars agree w/ you is false/doesnt belong in an encyc & violation of Wikipedia spirit: You may be unaware of huge lit on Feudal India,Japan,China,Iran,E.Africa, etc, but dont impose!
"Feudalism" = Europe. No scholar of the period uses the term outside of a European context except rhetorically (well, sometimes Japan, this is covered in discussion)
The previous claim is just plain false and displays a particular position in a controversial debate. The new edit displays a balance among the competing positions.
